reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night, average budget hotel, nothing fancy or attractive. Very basic lobby, only one person on the check in counter, and was mostly busy on the phone.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: Stayed in King suite, very average and needs uplifting and a make over. The restaurant is more like a bistro, but food was delicious, drinks were nicely made. All in all, if you are looking for an average budget hotel in between flights you will be fine.
reviews.title: LOVELY SUITES AND TOP FLOOR SMOKING SUITES

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this Radisson Hotel several times. The rooms are always clean and the staff are very helpful. The beds are in a separate room, which is awesome.
reviews.title: Happy With Our Stay

reviews.text: This hotel still keeps their top floor available for Smoking Suites. Thank you Radisson>
reviews.title: Friendly staff and clean rooms

reviews.text: We stayed here for a Park and Fly Stopover package before our flight the next day. We upgraded to the Executive Suite at check in for a little more money. This put us on the quieter, card access higher floors, with a newer room. The hotel is located on the flight path for the planes, but noise was really not an issue nor would I think any worse than other hotels near the airport. If you like watching planes, there is no shortage here.
reviews.title: Great Deal for business travel or vacation

reviews.text: I stay in the Radisson Suite Hotel Toronto Airport every visit to Toronto. The staff always provides excellent service. Plus, the hotel is close to the airport. And there are plenty of good restaurants in the area. -JV
reviews.title: Always tops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night after dropping a family member off at the airport. we got a good rate and were impressed at first with the room, it had a separate bedroom from the sitting area, that was nice. There were 2 tv's and a desk to work on a laptop. We were resting and wanted to watch some TV on and the remote wouldn't work at first then after working the buttons a few times it started to work a bit. I wanted to use the wifi, set up my laptop it connected fast but there was no visible outlet around the desk, had to move the couch to get to the outlet. We had the adjustable numbers beds and it was comfortable. In the morning we were going to have a shower and the slide in the spout to direct the water from the tub to the shower head was stuck, my wife couldn't move it up and I had a hard time but got it moving and I kept moving it up and down till it was freed. In my opinion the room hasn't been used for a while. When we checked in the staff were very friendly, helpful and check in was quick. The only drawback is that we had to pay for parking and breakfast wasn't offered also they should have a better sign on Dixon Rd. where to turn in.
reviews.title: First timer

reviews.text: We would come back again when we are in the area.
reviews.title: Great Hotel near airport

reviews.text: Great Airport hotel with superb customer service. Easy access to shuttle and room was clean and comfortable. My return flight was canceled twice and Radisson did not charge me for the extra day parking. Will stay here again.
reviews.title: Grace under pressure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well Done!
reviews.title: Clean, convenient.

reviews.text: One advantage this hotel has over the other is the size of the room. Big living room area including a work desk. Kitchenette with fridge and microwave. However, what works against it is the age of the hotel and lack of amenities. Due to the age of the hotel and window not able to be opened, the hotel spray room refreshener quite heavy. I had to cough when I walked into the room. Reception can use more than 1 staff that was behind the counter. Yes, the gym is not up to par to many mid range hotels. However, you get what you pay for. By the way, I didn't hear any airplane noise. Overall, it's not bad.
reviews.title: If space is important to you

reviews.text: ...but it's not real good either.
reviews.title: It's not bad...

reviews.text: Stayed here on business and I must say I was disappointed. Rooms were nice and large but kind of worn out and tired. They say they have a Fitness Center but they really have one room with two treadmills, (one broken) a universal machine and five mismatching weights. So...they don't have a fitness centre. Also, after 11:00pm ish, there is NO food anywhere near here. All pubs, restaurants, even room service was closed!
reviews.title: Great location
Average hotel close to the airport
reviews.text: Overall, still a comfortable, pleasant stay. (As long as you don't need to take the shuttle to the airport, this service is very poor).
And they still have the sleep number beds which is enough to send me to another hotel next stay in Toronto.
reviews.title: Very welcoming staff

reviews.text: Was treated first rate right from the time I walked into the hotel to the time I left. I had no problems at all. The room was extremely comfortable. The bed, a sleep number king size was awesome! Recommend this hotel to anyone traveling or in the area for business, and it cost less than I expected. I have stayed in much worse but spent much more. This is a great deal for the budget minded guest.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for business

reviews.text: Very clean and the business class suite was very organized clean and had had everything I needed. Including a large desk and separate bedroom with sleep number mattress! Front desk staff were all extremely pleasant, jovial and motivated to make my experience efficient and as comfortable as possible. The three gentlemen I dealt with had a great sense of humor and made the mundane tasks of checking in and out pleasurable.
reviews.title: Front desk staff on check in and checkout were exceptionally pleasant to deal with and showed their genuine concern for all of m

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was satisfactory in terms of their upgraded suite on the executive floor, needs a modern touch.Rooms were clean. As for the staff and their willingness to accommodate the guests i would rate them a 5 (scale 1-5), great staff. Also have restaurants and a Tim's beside the hotel.Give this hotel a star rating of 3.5
reviews.title: Service
Great Again
reviews.text: We used this hotel again for a stay and fly. Clean and comfortable and they kept our vehicle for two weeks while we were away. Close enough to walk to a restaurant for dinner before gong to bed. No problem with the shuttle to the airport. Served its purpose perfectly. We would book here again!

I have used this hotel several times for its convenient location close to Toronto Airport and I was never disappointed. I have always been assigned a room on the Executive floor. These rooms are bigger with a separate door to the bedroom. There is a desk and a pull out couch as well as a Coffee machine, fax, data ports, fridge, and extra closet space.
reviews.title: Never disappointed with this Hotel
